message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product which has been highly valued by many of our customers. I believe it's worth more than its face value of $150, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $200. This is an exclusive opportunity to own this exceptional item.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $120. Can we meet in the middle?

Thank you for your interest, Bob. I appreciate your feedback. To accommodate your budget while still valuing the product appropriately, I am willing to negotiate at $140. This price reflects a compromise between our initial positions and allows both parties to benefit.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm still a bit higher than my budget. Would you be willing to go down to $100?

I understand your position, Bob. In order to reach a mutually beneficial agreement, I am willing to consider $110 as the final price for the product. This price respects your budget while still allowing me to achieve a satisfactory return for the value provided.
I'm getting close to my budget, but I'd like to get a bit closer to the price I was thinking. Would you be willing to meet me at $90?

Considering your recent proposal, I am willing to negotiate further. For the sake of closing the deal and respecting your budget, I propose a final price of $95 for the product. This represents a compromise that I hope will be agreeable to both of us.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $85?

I understand your constraints, Bob. To facilitate a sale and accommodate your budget, I am willing to accept $90 as the final price for the product. This price respects your financial considerations while still allowing me to achieve a reasonable return for the value provided.
I appreciate your efforts to negotiate, but I'm at my limit. I'm willing to pay $80 for the product. This is my final offer.
